description: The Queen of Swords wears a stern look as she sits high on the throne - looking off into the distance. A queen of the air element that the swords represents, her place in the clouds shows that no one can trick or fool her. The sword in her right hand is pointed towards the sky, whereas the left hand is extended like it is offering something. The Queen of Swords gives us the gift of judgment for everyday decisions and having the flexibility to take in knowledge from others.

upright.overview:
The Queen of Swords is an archetype of an older, wiser feminine intellect. She could be thought of as the most masculine of the all the queens, and may come off as quite stern and emotionless. This card represents the importance of making judgments without relying on emotion alone. The Queen of Swords beckons you to look at all the facts before making a decision. This queen does have compassion, which is why she has her hand reaching outwards in offering, but she wants to connect to people using an understanding that is intellectual.

This card represents the importance of making judgments without relying on emotion alone. The Queen of Swords beckons you to look at all the facts before making a decision.

This card also means that you will need to become independent with your judgments. You must rely on the unbiased intelligence, which has you researching alternative viewpoints and thinking carefully on your decision. Compassion and empathy in these cases can distract you from your task, so you need you are trying to keep a strong objective view while avoiding getting emotions involved.
The Queen of Swords can also be about the way that we speak with others. This queen has the ability to tell people the way it is. This allows her to get her point across, so there is no confusion about what is being said. Above all, truth is important to her, so she feels no need to soften her comments, thoughts, or opinions. She also expects the same frankness from other people, so this means that you need to be clear with everything that is being said, even if it may hurt.
upright.love_meaning: The person represented by the Queen of Swords can be a loner; she is very discerning about the people she surrounds herself with. Her intellect is sharp and perceptive, and her determination can be rather intimidating to those that do not know her well. Underneath her shell however, she can be loving and loyal, though she may still prefer to avoid grand romantic displays. If this is someone whose heart you’ll like to win, you’ll need patience, as this queen does not easily let down her guard. If this card doesn’t represent a person, the Queen of Swords tarot love meaning can suggest a time when you are looking for both independence and self-sufficiency alongside your partnership. This queen values her own space and identity. You may have to make some adjustments to create clarity and boundaries in your relationship.
upright.career_meaning: The Queen of Swords can point to either someone more senior, or yourself in a career tarot reading. This person is wise, honest, and may be a source of constructive criticism. They can offer great advice on how to proceed in your career. If this card represents you, you may be at a period in your life when you are able to get much respect from your colleagues. You are able to effectively communicate your sharp ideas, as well as combine them with a strong place of empathy. You’ll likely have a strong reputation due to your integrity and your fairness.
upright.finances_meaning: When dealing with financial matters, you’ll need to act with consideration, logic and wisdom right now. Have a clear balance between heart and head. If you’re being asked to help with someone’s financial situation, look at things fairly, from both your perspective and theirs. This can usually mean being able to give assistance, but with boundaries. Put together a contract, or a payment plan; set some rules. This queen is also sharp and perceptive; noticing all details. Make sure you have clarity about your financial situation.
upright.as_feelings:
The Queen of Swords reveals a person who feels deeply but approaches their emotions with clarity and intellect. They admire your honesty and directness, placing a high value on communication. Their feelings for you are shaped by keen perception; they appreciate your authenticity while expecting transparency in return. This individual is discerning, carefully weighing their emotions against past experiences.
Drawing the Queen of Swords encourages you to embrace rationality alongside emotion. You may find yourself seeking truth and understanding in this connection, feeling empowered to express your thoughts openly. It’s a call to balance heart and mind as you navigate these complex feelings, allowing both intuition and logic to guide your path forward together.
upright.as_actions: With the Queen of Swords, now is the time for clarity and decisive action. You should embrace your intellect and communicate with honesty, cutting through confusion in your life. This means evaluating situations critically, setting clear boundaries, and expressing your thoughts openly. Consider journaling to articulate your feelings or engaging in conversations that require transparency. It’s also a good moment to seek out knowledge: perhaps take a course or read books that challenge your perspective. By doing so, you empower yourself to make informed decisions while fostering an environment of truthfulness around you.
upright.love: picky about lovers, independent partner, boundaries
upright.career: constructive criticism, wise guidance, respect in field
upright.finances: acting with logic and reason, financial clarity

reversed.overview: A reversed Queen of Swords is someone who is bitter, manipulative, overly critical and can be downright cruel. This person can represent you our your partner at this particular time, or alternatively, someone outside of the relationship that is attempting to interfere. Sometimes, this person’s nastiness can be the result of trauma, and because of this, if your partner is demonstrating these traits, it can sometimes be the result of unresolved trauma that is coming to the surface. If you are single, there can be the chance that you have just gone through a break up, one that has left you feeling vengeful and unforgiving. These beliefs can be toxic; learn to use your experiences to overcome them, instead of being consumed by them.

reversed.career_meaning: Is there someone at work who is holding a grudge against you? The Queen of Swords reversed can indicate an overly critical person who uses her words and her intellect to create suffering. She can be harsh, and sometimes downright cruel with how she expresses herself. If this is you, you may need to learn how to communicate better. Can you be honest while also caring for another person’s feelings? Can you address your concerns about a project without blaming someone? These may actually benefit you by helping others better digest your ideas. Avoid being too negative.
reversed.finances_meaning: If you’ve been communicating about finances poorly, you may be dealing with the consequences right now. Lack of clarity about your own financial situation could also be the culprit. Perhaps you lent money to a friend or a family member, who has failed to pay you back, or you may have given or spent more than you could actually afford. You’ll need to make sure that you’re more clear about your own boundaries and limits next time.
reversed.as_feelings:
When you draw the reversed Queen of Swords, it reveals a complex emotional landscape. If you are asking how this person feels about you, they may be experiencing confusion or mistrust. Their feelings could be clouded by past experiences that have left them feeling vulnerable and defensive. They might struggle to communicate their emotions clearly, leading to misunderstandings between you.
The arrival of this card suggests a moment to reflect on your own feelings as well. You may find yourself grappling with uncertainty and self-doubt. The reversed Queen suggests that you could be overthinking situations or allowing negative thoughts to overshadow your clarity. It’s essential to acknowledge these emotions and seek ways to regain balance and confidence within yourself as you navigate this intricate connection.
reversed.as_actions: As the Queen of Swords appears in reverse, it’s a powerful reminder to turn inward for emotional clarity. You may need to reassess your communication style, focusing on empathy rather than criticism. Consider journaling your thoughts to untangle any confusion or negativity clouding your judgment. Engage in conversations with loved ones where you listen more than you speak, allowing their perspectives to reshape yours. This card encourages you to let go of harsh judgments and embrace vulnerability, fostering deeper connections. By prioritizing understanding over logic, you'll find new insights that can guide your actions moving forward.

abyss: The Queen of Swords rests her head contemplatively upon the hilt of her sword, allowing its metallic coolness to center and still her. She makes use of that stillness to channel the knowledge emanating from the Sphere of Light affixed to the sword’s pommel. She is introspective and reflective, characteristics indicative of a strong queen. There are times when she must be as still as the night, yet as swift as an arrow in her decision-making. The Queen of Swords rules with her head first and her heart second, reason trumping her emotional yearnings. Yet, she bears a certain wisdom that places public responsibility above her private desires. It is no easy burden to bear, and there are times when it leaves her feeling very alone. In those moments of despair and despondency, she returns to the safety and security of her faithful blade, the keen and piercing intellect and indomitable will that have always safeguarded her on her journey through the twists and turns of the mysterious labyrinth. Regardless of how unpleasant it may be, the Queen of Swords must always face the truth in a situation with dignity and poise. Many people find this to be too much, preferring instead for the truth to be shrouded or silenced, in order to spare their feelings. The Queen is afforded no such luxury. Likewise, there are times when we have to harness the energy of the Queen of Swords, revealing truths to others that they don’t want to hear or are presently incapable of acknowledging. True friends are there to comfort and care for us, however, they also play the essential role of pointing out our poor choices or faulty judgments. If you are being called upon to play the part of the Queen of Swords, remember that it’s not just what you say, but how you say it. By phrasing and framing your critiques constructively, you are much more likely to have your message heard. Alternatively, if a dear friend or trusted companion is presently pointing out possible lapses of judgment on your part, have the courage and trust to at least consider their point of view.
